course.subject: MARK
course.name: Pricing Strategy
course.description: This course is designed to deepen understanding of pricing issues which marketing managers may face under some degree of market power.  The course will develop basic pricing theories and concepts from economics and marketing and present managerial implications for decision making.

reviews.author: Sean10
reviews.title: Course Review
reviews.comment_content: Pricing strategies have contents that is both easily relatable and comprehensible. There are a little bit of basic calculations and equations to derive optimal prices, but very rudimentary mathematics. The professor gives a lot of  interesting real life examples during class , and there are several case studies to read and prepare before class.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor really tries to get everyone actively participate. And, stays a while after class to cover any parts that students were not able to understand. His teaching was overall very satisfying
reviews.comment_grading:
- Two best quizzes out of three are counted towards your grade and the mean tend to rise so be sure to study for second and third quiz even if you did well on the first.
- Group project report and presentation is important but the discrepancy amongst group does not seem to be large (so I would recommend to make some gap through quiz)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not heavy. Infact I think its quite light for a 4 credit course.

reviews.author: chanandler bong
reviews.title: Best Marketing Course in UST
reviews.comment_content: Pricing strategies ranging from different theories to real life applications. The course is split into three modules. The first module covers basic theories like EV model. The second module covers different price segmentation fences. The third module covers pricing wars and consumer laws. The modules also have one case study at the end. These case studies will be included in the quizzes. There are alot of real world applications as well in the modules. It is a very interesting course and you ll come out as a smart shopper.
reviews.comment_teaching: Excellent teaching. The Professor is really involved in the class. He asks alot of questions in class which creates alot of engagement. He is also very lively so his classes are never boring. Definitely one of the best profs in UST. Take the course for the prof even if you don't like this topic, he ll make you like the topic towards the end !
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is pretty standard. There are 3 quizzes. Best two out of three is counted. The quizzes get harder as they go so make sure you do well in the first 2. There is also a group project and a mini project. Participation is also important in the class so make sure you ask alot of questions. I think the professor is fair with his grading.
reviews.comment_workload: You can expect alot of workload in this course since it is 4 credits. The group project I would say requires alot of effort and time since you have to think of a new pricing structure for an existing business. If you dont have a good group then I would say  you'll find the project hard. The quizzes are split according to the modules. The modules get harder as you progress through the semester.

reviews.author: hjk
reviews.title: MARK3480 Course Review (Online)
reviews.comment_content:
I believe this course has only recently been introduced in HKUST. This course is about pricing which is one of the core component in a business marketing strategy. More specifically the content is divided into three module which are:
- Module 1) Value Pricing Framework
- Module 2) Pricing Strategies & Tactics
- Module 3) Pricing Innovations & Ethics
The last module is shorter than the first two, and there is quiz at the end of each module.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice and fun, is willing to interact with students and answer questions. Even though the whole semester went online, he utilized Zoom quite effectively - meaning I have no idea how better or worse he could be offline. Nevertheless, he is a very qualified and enthusiastic professor. The TA is also cool and helps out.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading scheme is:
- First best Quiz (25%)
- Second best Quiz (25%)
- Participation (8%)
- Group Project (40%)
- Marketing Experiment (2%)
Group project is the main component of grading scheme, and the quiz only takes best two out of three. Therefore, you may want to put more emphasis on the group project which has two part - pricing puzzle and pricing project. Refer to syllabus for details.
(Group project really does matter, as even I got above mean for Quiz 2 and 3 I ended up with a C due to bad score in group project)
reviews.comment_workload: As mentioned before, the course content itself is not too challenging; the main problem is the group project which has some workload. Attending the Marketing Experiment was easier online, and participation was also not too demanding. Just deal with the GP.
